    • ensureItemProperties

      protected CompoundTag ensureItemProperties()

    • name

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder name(String name)
      Sets the name of the item, if not defined will default to language resource_packs,

      if no translation is provided in RP, will default to the item Id.

      Parameters:
      name - string item name

    • creativeCategory

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder creativeCategory(CreativeCategory creativeCategory)
      The Creative Category that includes the specified item. Accepted categories are CONSTRUCTION | EQUIPMENT | ITEMS | NATURE | NONE

      Examples: 

       // Specificy item to be at category tab Equipments
 creativeCategory(CreativeCategory.EQUIPMENT);
      See Also:
      • bedrock wiki

    • creativeGroup

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder creativeGroup(CreativeGroup creativeGroup)
      The Creative Group that that includes the specified item. Vanilla accepted groups can be defined by CreativeGroup.

      Examples: 

       // Specificy the item to be part of chestplates group
 creativeGroup(CreativeGroup.CHESTPLATE);
      See Also:
      • bedrock wiki

    • creativeGroup

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder creativeGroup(String creativeGroup)
      The Creative Group that that includes the specified item. Custom groups can be defined by CreativeCustomGroups.

      Examples: 

       // Specificy the item to be part of axes items
 creativeGroup("minecraft:itemGroup.name.axe");
 // Specificy the item to be part of a custom group (the group must be registered with CreativeCustomGroups)
 creativeGroup("My Custom Group");
      See Also:
      • bedrock wiki

    • isHiddenInCommands

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder isHiddenInCommands(boolean hidden)
      Sets if item will be hidden from commands and not able to be called from.
      Parameters:
      hidden - boolean true/false

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder texture(String texture)

      Parameters:
      texture - string name for the mapped texture in the resource_pack

    • blockPlacer

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder blockPlacer(String blockId, String... useOn)
      Sets the item as a planter item component for blocks.

      Also allows the item to render as a 3D block, for that you need also to provide the desired block with your custom geometry.

      Parameters:
      blockId - sting name id of the desired block
      useOn - set of string block Ids of blocks that this block can be placed

      Parameters:
      glint - boolean true/false

    • tag

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder tag(String... tags)

       // Single tag
 tag("my_custom_tag");
 // Multiple tags
 tag("my_custom_tag1", "my_custom_tag2");
      Parameters:
      tags - set of string tags

    • durability

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder durability(int maxDurability)
      Sets item durability (Bedrock "minecraft:durability").

      If not set: damage_chance min invalid input: '&' max defaults to 100.

      Parameters:
      maxDurability - int value, must be >= 0

    • durability

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder durability(int maxDurability, int damageChanceMin, int damageChanceMax)
      Sets item durability (Bedrock "minecraft:durability").

      damage_chance will randomize between the min invalid input: '&' max.

      Parameters:
      maxDurability - int value, must be >= 0.
      damageChanceMin - int value, percentage change must be >= 0 invalid input: '&' invalid input: '<'=100.
      damageChanceMax - int value, percentage change must be >= 0 invalid input: '&' invalid input: '<'=100.

    • enchantable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder enchantable(ItemEnchantSlot slot, int value)
      Determines what enchantments can be applied to the item. 
       // Using ItemEchantSlot
 builder.enchantable(ItemEnchantSlot.SWORD, 10);
 // Using String slot
 builder.enchantable("pickaxe", 20);
      Parameters:
      slot - ItemEnchantSlot slot ID of the enchantable item
      value - int value, must be >= 0

    • enchantable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder enchantable(String slot, int value)
      Determines what enchantments can be applied to the item. 
       // Using ItemEchantSlot
 builder.enchantable(ItemEnchantSlot.SWORD, 10);
 // Using String slot
 builder.enchantable("pickaxe", 20);
      Parameters:
      slot - string slot ID of the enchantable item
      value - int value, must be >= 0

    • digger

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder digger(DiggerEntry... diggerEntries)
      Add one or more destroy_speeds entries to minecraft:digger.

      Each entry defines a mining speed and the blocks it applies to (either by a block id, a tag expression, or both). Examples: 

       // Specific block only
 digger(DiggerEntry.block("minecraft:coal_ore", 2));
 // built-in tag group (all wooden blocks)
 digger(DiggerEntry.create().speed(6).addAllWooden());
 // Custom tag
 digger(DiggerEntry.create().speed(5).addTags("'my_custom_tag'"));
 // Mix and match
 digger(
     DiggerEntry.create().speed(6).addTags("'wood'", "'my_custom_tag'"),
     DiggerEntry.block("minecraft:coal_ore", 2)
 ).useEfficiency(true);
      Parameters:
      diggerEntries - DiggerEntry of entries that can be used as single block or tags for query expressions.

    • useEfficiency

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder useEfficiency(boolean useEfficiency)
      Sets the use_efficiency flag for minecraft:digger.

      This value is only written when a digger(DiggerEntry...) call.

      Example: 

       digger(
     DiggerEntry.block("minecraft:coal_ore", 2),
     DiggerEntry.create().speed(6).addAllWooden()
 ).useEfficiency(true);
      Parameters:
      useEfficiency - whether efficiency enchantments should speed up mining

    • wearable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder wearable(String slot)
      Set Armor Item.

      Note: Bedrock requires the max stack size is set to 1.

      protection defaults to 0, hides_player_location defaults to false. Examples: 

       // Set wearable with string slot ID
 wearable("armor_head");
      Parameters:
      slot - string slot where the item will be allowed to wear
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if slot is unknown

    • wearable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder wearable(String slot, int protection)
      Set Armor Item.

      Note: Bedrock requires the max stack size is set to 1.

      hides_player_location defaults to false. Examples: 

       // Set wearable with string slot ID and protection value
 wearable("armor_head", 7);
      Parameters:
      slot - string slot where the item will be allowed to wear
      protection - protection level of the item.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if slot is unknown

    • wearable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder wearable(String slot, int protection, boolean hidesPlayerLocation)
      Set Armor Item.

      Note: Bedrock requires the max stack size is set to 1.

      hides_player_location defaults to false. Examples: 

       // Set wearable with string slot ID, protection value and hides_player_location true
 wearable("armor_head", 7, true);
      Parameters:
      slot - string slot where the item will be allowed to wear
      protection - protection level of the item.
      hidesPlayerLocation - if true and worn hides player on locator maps and the locator bar.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if slot is unknown

    • wearable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder wearable(ItemArmorType slot)
      Set Armor Item.

      Note: Bedrock requires the max stack size is set to 1.

      protection defaults to 0, hides_player_location defaults to false. Examples: 

       // Set wearable with armor type ID
 wearable(ItemArmorType.HEAD);
      Parameters:
      slot - ItemArmorType where the item will be allowed to wear

    • wearable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder wearable(ItemArmorType slot, int protection)
      Set Armor Item.

      Note: Bedrock requires the max stack size is set to 1.

      hides_player_location defaults to false. Examples: 

       // Set wearable with armor type ID and protection value
 wearable(ItemArmorType.HEAD, 7);
      Parameters:
      slot - ItemArmorType where the item will be allowed to wear
      protection - protection level of the item.

    • wearable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder wearable(ItemArmorType slot, int protection, boolean hidesPlayerLocation)
      Set Armor Item.

      Note: Bedrock requires the max stack size is set to 1.

      hides_player_location defaults to false. Examples: 

       // Set wearable with armor type ID, protection value and hides_player_location true
 wearable(ItemArmorType.HEAD, 7, true);
      Parameters:
      slot - ItemArmorType where the item will be allowed to wear
      protection - protection level of the item.
      hidesPlayerLocation - if true and worn hides player on locator maps and the locator bar.

    • repairable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder repairable(RepairEntry... repairEntries)
      Defines the items that can be used to repair a defined item, and the amount of durability each item restores upon repair. Examples: 
       // single entry with fixed durability restored
 repairable(RepairEntry.set("minecraft:gold_ingot").amount(80f));
 // multiple repairEntries at once
 repairable(
     RepairEntry.set("minecraft:iron_ingot")
         .amountExpr("context.other->q.remaining_durability + 0.25 * context.other->q.max_durability"),
     RepairEntry.set("minecraft:gold_ingot", "awp:my_custom_item")
         .amount(80f)
 );
      Parameters:
      repairEntries - one or more RepairEntry objects

    • repairable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder repairable(float amount, String... itemIds)

    • repairable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder repairable(String expression, String... itemIds)

    • repairable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder repairable(List<String> itemIds, String expression)

    • food

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder food(boolean canAlwaysEat)
      Sets the item as a food component, allowing it to be edible to the player.

      Note: Bedrock requires minecraft:use_modifiers for eat/drink behavior. Call useModifiers(float, float) to set the use time (seconds) and movement modifier. If you skip it, this builder will use duration as 0s and movement as 1.0 by default.

      nutrition defaults to 0, saturation_modifier defaults to 0.6, using_converts_to defaults to "".

      Parameters:
      canAlwaysEat - if true, food can be always eaten even without hungry

    • food

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder food(boolean canAlwaysEat, int nutrition, float saturationModifier)
      Sets the item as a food component, allowing it to be edible to the player.

      Note: Bedrock requires minecraft:use_modifiers for eat/drink behavior. Call useModifiers(float, float) to set the use time (seconds) and movement modifier. If you skip it, this builder will use duration as 0s and movement as 1.0 by default.

      using_converts_to defaults to "".

      Parameters:
      canAlwaysEat - if true, food can be always eaten even without hungry
      nutrition - nutrition level of the food as int value
      saturationModifier - saturation modifier provides the saturation of the food by: (nutrition * saturation_modifier * 2), defaults is 0.6

    • food

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder food(boolean canAlwaysEat, int nutrition, float saturationModifier, String usingConvertsTo)
      Sets the item as a food component, allowing it to be edible to the player.

      Note: Bedrock requires minecraft:use_modifiers for eat/drink behavior. Call useModifiers(float, float) to set the use time (seconds) and movement modifier. If you skip it, this builder will use duration as 0s and movement as 1.0 by default.

      Parameters:
      canAlwaysEat - if true, food can be always eaten even without hungry
      nutrition - nutrition level of the food as int value
      saturationModifier - saturation modifier provides the saturation of the food by: (nutrition * saturation_modifier * 2), defaults is 0.6
      usingConvertsTo - string item ID that this food will convert to after eaten, example "minecraft:bowl"

    • shooter

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder shooter(float maxDrawDuration, boolean scalePowerByDrawDuration, boolean chargeOnDraw, ShooterAmmo... ammunition)
      Compels an item to shoot projectiles, similarly to a bow or crossbow.

      Supports optional ammunition definitions (ShooterAmmo), Example: 

       customBuilder(myBow)
     .shooter(1.0f,
         ShooterAmmo.set("awp:arrow")
             .useOffhand(true)
             .searchInventory(true)
             .useInCreative(true)
     );
      Parameters:
      maxDrawDuration - Time (in seconds) to fully draw the shooter
      scalePowerByDrawDuration - If true, power scales with draw time
      chargeOnDraw - If true, consumes ammo immediately on draw
      ammunition - Optional list of allowed ammunition types

    • shooter

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder shooter(float maxDrawDuration, ShooterAmmo... ammunition)
      Compels an item to shoot projectiles, similarly to a bow or crossbow.

      Defaults: scalePowerByDrawDuration = true, chargeOnDraw = false. Example: 

       customBuilder(myBow)
     .shooter(1.2f, ShooterAmmo.set("awp:arrow"));

    • shooterFlags

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder shooterFlags(float maxDrawDuration, boolean scalePowerByDrawDuration, boolean chargeOnDraw)
      Compels an item to shoot projectiles, similarly to a bow or crossbow.

      Example: 

       customBuilder(myWand)
     .shooterFlags(0.5f, true, false);

    • throwable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder throwable(boolean doSwingAnimation, float launchPowerScale, float maxDrawDuration, float maxLaunchPower, float minDrawDuration, boolean scalePowerByDrawDuration)
      Sets the throwable item component. Configures the minecraft:throwable component.

      Parameters:
      doSwingAnimation - Determines whether the item should use the swing animation when thrown.
      launchPowerScale - The scale at which the power of the throw increases.
      maxDrawDuration - The maximum duration to draw a throwable item.
      maxLaunchPower - The maximum power to launch the throwable item.
      minDrawDuration - The minimum duration to draw a throwable item.
      scalePowerByDrawDuration - Whether or not the power of the throw increases with duration charged.

    • throwable

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder throwable(boolean doSwingAnimation, float launchPowerScale, float maxLaunchPower)
      Sets the throwable item component. Configures the minecraft:throwable component.

      Parameters:
      doSwingAnimation - Determines whether the item should use the swing animation when thrown.
      launchPowerScale - The scale at which the power of the throw increases.
      maxLaunchPower - The maximum power to launch the throwable item.
      maxDrawDuration - The maximum duration to draw a throwable item. Default is set to 0.0.
      minDrawDuration - The minimum duration to draw a throwable item. Default is set to 0.0.
      scalePowerByDrawDuration - Whether or not the power of the throw increases with duration charged. Default is set to false

    • fuel

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder fuel(float duration)
      Allows this item to be used as fuel in a furnace to 'cook' other items.
      Parameters:
      duration - float seconds this item burns for.

    • useAnimation

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder useAnimation(String animation)
      use_animation specifies which animation is played when the player uses the item. Examples: "eat", "drink", "bow".
      Parameters:
      animation - string animation

    • useModifiers

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder useModifiers(float movementModifier, float useDurationSeconds)
      Determines how long an item takes to use in combination with components such as Shooter, Throwable, or Food.
      Parameters:
      movementModifier - float moviment reduction while using this item
      useDurationSeconds - float seconds to successful use this item

    • cooldown

      public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder cooldown(String category, float duration)
      The duration of time (in seconds) items with a matching category will spend cooling down before becoming usable again.
      Parameters:
      category - string category cooldown name of this item
      duration - float seconds value to fully cooldown items of the same category name

    • customBuild

      public CustomItemDefinition customBuild(Consumer<CompoundTag> nbtConsumer)
      Custom processing of the item to be sent to the client ComponentNBT, which contains all definitions for custom item.

      You can modify them as much as you want, under the right conditions.

    • build

      public CustomItemDefinition build()

    • buildDefinition

      protected CustomItemDefinition buildDefinition()
      Finalizes and assembles the complete custom item definition NBT to be sent to the client.

    • addRepairs

      @Deprecated protected CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder addRepairs(@NotNull @NotNull List<String> repairItemNames, String molang)
      Deprecated.
      Legacy method for adding repair rules.

      This method writes minecraft:repairable.repair_items directly with a list of item names and a Molang expression for the repair amount. It only supports expression-based repair.

      Use repairable(RepairEntry...) instead.

      • Support both numeric and expression-based repair amounts
      • Allow flexible argument styles (IDs, Items, Lists)

    • renderOffsets

      @Deprecated public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder renderOffsets(@NotNull @NotNull RenderOffsets renderOffsets)
      Deprecated.
      This method was deprecated by Mojang and can suddenly stop working on Minecraft clients, prefer migrating your items to use resource_packs attachables. Control rendering offsets of custom items at different viewpoints

    • miningSpeed

      @Deprecated public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder miningSpeed(float speed)
      Deprecated.
      Mining speed is not present in any Microsoft / Mojang docs, it might have deprecated as it also is part of item properties as most of legacy deprecated components. Prefer using digger(cn.nukkit.item.utils.DiggerEntry...) component.

    • makePersistent

      @Deprecated public CustomItemDefinition.SimpleBuilder makePersistent(boolean makePersistent)
      Deprecated.
      to avoid misleading, use
      invalid reference 
      #shouldDespawn()
      instead. Make persistent component determines if the item should eventually despawn/or not while floating in the world
      Parameters:
      persistent - boolean true/flase
